Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublinroamer52
Reviews.Content: We found it a perfect location for sightseeing and eating out. So close to train and bus services and so easy to get around from here. The rooms were very clean and well laid out. The breakfast perfect with lots of choice. The staff were very nice and eager to help. We will return for sure and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Mecure”
Reviews.Author: bodie_t
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, friendly, helpfull staff. Overall a good experience. Easy walk to train station and lots of places to eat. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AlainWien Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very good room. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Plentiful breakfast. And all of this at a relatively low price.

Reviews.Title: “Great supprise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the time i checked in to the time I checked out it was very nice, very friendly, seems family run , very unexpected for a Mercure.Very nice and friendly staff, Very good breakfast ( more than only sausages , with very nice touches), they set a coffee machine and different sweets every day, nice touch. Some feedback for these prices, i would expect slippers and bathrobe, TV s channels very poor, no movie channels. The only English programs are news channels. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: Zaza64
Reviews.Content: Arrived at around 12.30PM. Was sick and had high temperature. Have explained that at the reception, however was denied to get a room, because you can get it only after 3 PM. Minus 10 outside and I was suggested walking and coming later. Have asked metro tickets and to put the payment on the room number. was refused, as they did not know which room I will get, even I was asked to give the a credit card to make reservation for extra expenses. It is a case, when you are asking yourself, why you need to have human beings working at the reception, as auto response machine can do the same things.

Reviews.Title: “Good middle classe business hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JohannesF
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night on a business trip. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice (however small) room, very clean, fair sleeping comfort. Wide range of TV stations. Biggest draw back was the fact that the room didn't have a minibar (machine on the 1st floor). Didn't explore the area much but it is well located, close to U-Bahn, 20EUR taxi ride from Tegel. Very good value for money for the single room. Good breakfast selection, however quite expensive (19EUR) in relation to room price and Berlin price level in general. Would/will come back if I have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice standard hotel, good situated in the KuDam area. Nice clean room. No restaurant and bar in the hotel, but plenty in the surounding area. As the weather in Berlin was very cold, unfortunately also my room was a bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Mamarok
Reviews.Content: A very recommendable hotel for its category, with a great breakfast buffet and extremely friendly service. The underground station is just around the corner and the best hotel to choose if you plan to visit the Natural History museum. Very central but quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to be recomended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable hotel with convenient location, good facilities and service of high quality. Good price, and the hotel definetely worth it The only thing I missed during my stay was free Wi-Fi

Reviews.Title: “Well connected, good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in very good location, just across the U-bahn that connects with Tegel airport shuttle bus. Berlin U&S-bahn take you effortlessly across Berlin. Quiet rooms, some wear and tear visible as expected from hotel with this price range. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing considering my room choice”
Reviews.Author: Alex-Bex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. My colleague and I needed a hotel located centrally between Tegel Airport and our client's offices. The Mercure was well located for this. When researching the hotels which my client had recommended, the Mercure seemed to tick most boxes and seemed ideal. I chose the superior room which sounded ideal. On arrival I'm glad that I had done so as the room, to me, was what I would expect from a standard. Small bathroom, poor view, slightly cramped room and a heating system which maintained the room at one permament setting....roasting. As a result I woke twice in the night so didn't have the best night's sleep. Everything else about the hotel was as expected and the staff, I must say, were certainly helpful and polite. The room was a let down but it served its purpose, especially as it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: tsachiy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fantastic location almost on the main avenue - the ku-damm, vert big and clean rooms, quiet all around, very decent pricing.one bus (no. 109) takes you from tegel airport and back to a stop 50 meters away from the hotel for 2.30 euros each way...

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: atrejseeratleve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business trip and will stay again on an upcomingtrip. Found the rooms have good beds and are well-equipped, including espresso maker, but rather small and with ho-hum towel quality. Still, the hotel feels modern and well-organized. Buffet breakfast was nice, and they also had gluten-free bread on hand which I always appreciate. Business pet-peeve: cumbersome internet access setup -- have to get access code in the lobby. The hotel is conveniently located in Mitte and there's a U-bahn station less than a block away; plenty of restaurants and coffee shops in the neighbourhood, and plenty more within easy walking distance. Would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers, but not for a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ruby R
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Tegel airport bus to the Central station, and it took us no more than 15 minutes to reach this hotel by foot. It is located next to the Nature museum, which looks really nice. A metro station is just 50 meters away, which is great for travelling around the city. But actually it's not far to reach the city center by foot. The shopping street Friedrichstrasse is very close, so the location is perfect both for sightseeing and shopping :) We came to the hotel a few hours earlier than the check-in time, but the staff offered us a smoking room instead of the booked non-smoking one if we wanted to check in immediately. This was really helpful, because we were really tired after the flight. Overall, the staff was very welcoming and friendly. Everything about the room was great - its size, design, cleanliness and comfort. Even though it was a smoking one, I never noticed any cigarette smell. One thing I really missed - wifi wasn't free in the hotel. However, there were 2 laptops in the lobby with free access and a connected printer, which was helpful for printing our boarding passes. But despite of this inconvenience with wifi, I'm still sure about giving the hotel such a high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Len_Aye
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 night at the hotel during a business trip and was surprised by how fresh and modern the whole place looked. Buffet breakfast was ample in choice including cooked food as well as traditional continental affair. There's a U-bahn station 100 yards from the hotel and it's very convenient to go to any place from this station. There's wifi in the room but it's a paid service but speed and signal strength is good (I was on the top floor of the hotel). I had a standard room with a double bed, and comes with a flat screen TV with about 60 channels (all German, sadly) but no fridge or mini bar or tea/coffee making facilities. There is a bottle of water provided but the price was €3.50, so I didn't drink it. There's a supermarket very close by so you can get most things from there, along with a coffee shop and a Subway. All in all, a clean and convenient place for business travellers or families.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllanW4
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with friendly staff, who can speak fluent english. They spent a considerable amount of time and effort booking me on tours, which made my stay all the more enjoyable. The breakfast buffet was the most comprehensive I've seen for a considerable number of years. The evening meals were reasonably priced, and were tasty. I agree with the previous reviewer, the pillows were rubbish! My wife needed 3! I also like tea and coffee making facilities in my room, but I'm guessing this may be a german thing? Overall I would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Why does a business hotel charge extra for using the internet?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It makes no sense to me to charge extra, as Mercure does, just to use the internet in a business hotel. This should be an "included" service, like using the elevator. Their service does not even link to the hotel bill, but requires setting up an account with a third-party firm, including typing in complete customer information, address, etc. I guess this was needed to verify the credit card I was required to use, but I'll be triply disappointed if I start getting spam from this telecoms outfit too. .

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get discounted rates!”
Reviews.Author: WestsideRen
Reviews.Content: The standard prices are not too impresive, but if you can nab the discounts then it's worth a stay. Nice clean hotel, close to Naturkundemuseum on the U-bahn line 6. Supermarkets and coffee shop close by, and just a few stops on the U-bahn to the key spots around Berlin. Free internet and printing in the lobby at stand-up computer desks, and helpful staff who speak English. The downsides: we booked a king size bed and got two singles pushed together (!!), and there are no tea or coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location but has some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: sissiscutie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a European trip we took in late July and most of August 2011 taking in some of the prime stops in central Europe. I should initially point out that we got a deal whereby we stayed here for half price, so our expectations weren't too high to only be paying around €35 per night. However, when we got to our room, we did find it to be noticeably small and simple, though the bathroom was very smart, with good water pressure. The air con wasn't great, just as we had experienced at another Mercure in Cologne only days earlier. I was very surprised not to have a minibar in the room, and this appears to be the case throughout this hotel. However, the hotel is in a good location. We had so much luggage yet walked to and from the Hautbahnof which is about 20 minutes walk from the hotel. Many of Berlin's best attractions are also within walking distance, such as museum island (about 30-40mins) and the Reichstag (40mins). The hotel is additionally right next to a metro station which will take you to these places in minutes. There is also a wonderful Italian restaurant (about 10 minutes walk) called Roma nearby, where we both enjoyed one of the best pizzas we've ever consumed and beautiful house wine (1 litre) for €30 all in, so certainly a place to check out if you're in need of a cheap, but very apatezing (and romantic) meal. Pros Good location, 30 min walk from Museum Island, 2 min walk from nearby Metro station For near-central Berlin, it's good value. Good bathroom with good water pressure Cons No minibar/fridge The €9 (for 24h) in-room internet access isn't Wi-Fi but hard wired, and the cable is only 1.5 metres, so no chance of staying in bed when online. Air con was below average Only one extra pillow I would object to paying more than €80 per night, but since we got such a good deal, I would rate this hotel 4 stars, and certainly recommend it for singletons and couples for a short to medium length visit.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: morrisen
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was good (do buy it in advance unless you want to pay extra). Attended a conference that was within walking distance, but did notice that the location was not perfect when it comes to local traffic. Would recommend walking to S Berlin-Nordbahnhof‎ depending on where you are going. The room felt fresh and new.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Mercure at very good price”
Reviews.Author: robson71andy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located not so far from Berlin Hbf station ,however it is too far to carry a heavy bag . The metro station is just around the corner ,but it is necessary to change for the S-bahn to get to the Berlin main station. Standard room was clean , nice furnished but not so spacious. Bathroom was rather small but clean too. The view from the window was not so spectacular - the backyard wasn't lovely as was described in the hotel's leaflet. The staff in the lobby could smile a little more often . The breakfast was brilliant - the biggest choice of food I ever found in hotels, however the restaurant was crowded ( it doesn't mean I've had a problem with a table - none of this ) in the weekend. You will find some discount coupons to the museums in the lobby - don't miss out those ! I can recommend this hotel for a short or longer stay in Berlin - the prices are unbeatable !

Reviews.Title: “Poor price-quality ratio / Pitiful "upgraded" room & facilities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Specifically asked for "1 double bed" - got two single ones, which kept drifting apart... Upon (late) arrival and requesting that this be corrected, the front desk The "luxury" (or whatever they call it) top-up upgrade of the room was altogether underwhelming... I think in the end it consisted in a coffee/tea machine, and bathrobes which were of next-to-no use, considering how small (and only equipped with a shower, rather than a bath) the "upgraded" room and "luxury" bathroom were... Will definitely not choose this poor price-quality ratio again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but slightly far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is only one disadvantage with this hotel - it's location. It is slightly far from city center (because of complicated nature of Berlin it is more proper way to say - "city centers"), so you continually need to take a taxi or use subway. The good news is that there is U-bahn station in few steps of the hotel and huge Hauptbahnhof in 15 minutes walk. The bad news is that U-bahn is very uncomfortable in Berlin - it is very hot there in summer and you always need to walk a long way to change subway line. So, it might be reasonable to choose a hotel more close to one of hub-station, where you can more easily pick proper line at the start of your travel. Anyway, I liked this hotel - good price, nice clean rooms, hospitable and quick staff.

Reviews.Title: “No problem at all”
Reviews.Author: BenitoMadrid
Reviews.Content: I was there three nights due to a business trip. The room was clean and the windows closed very well, no noise came from the street. The hotel is situated close to downtown, you can go strolling away to Brandemburger Gate, Unter den Linden, etc. Reception desk personnel very active, quick check in and out. No problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering for a Berlin trip”
Reviews.Author: CaptainSlog1960
Reviews.Content: We found this Mercure was good base for exploring the city. It is just 3 stops from the centre of the city so you can be there less than 20 minutes. The room was clean, the staff were helpful and friendly. There is underground parking available at 9.90 Euros a day.

Reviews.Title: “Hot water...”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: Should the temperature of your hot water, in your accommodation, be a key criterion? I've often thought it, yet subliminally. This Mercure has a plentiful supply from the tap although, now I think about it, that's not been the case for all hotels I've stayed at over the last twelve months. So, plentiful hot water, a good shower (no bath tub), complimentary soap, shampoo and so forth. For what's a city centre hotel, the bedroom is of a reasonable size though a tad spartan in atmosphere (not so different to sister Ibis chain, then). Lighting is good by and large; could do with brighter or more directional bedside lights. As for the television, there are multiple channels but only three in English as far as I could ascertain. Now, the pièce de résistance on my first full day was breakfast (true for the second and, largely, for the third day). What an excellent selection: from several different types of yoghurt (not cartons) to the cheeses, salmon and meats. Well done, also, to Michalina (spelling ?) who welcomes you to the restaurant in the mornings. As for location, the hotel is about ten minutes walk from Berlin Hauptbahnhof (worth seeing in its own right) and four minutes from the Bertolt Brecht House, open to the public, at Chauseestrasse 125. I nearly forgot, the reception staff and others in the restaurant were very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoleGF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days with my family and really enjoyed it. The location is great, close to public transport and not far from the centre. The staff was helpful from the moment we arrived. The rooms were spacious and clean. My brother and his wife shared a room with their child and all was set up nicely for them. Breakfast was amazing, wide choice and really good value for money. The hotel itself was not expensive compared to others with a much lower standard so overall realyl pleased we found this place.

Reviews.Title: “No free internet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place but we had to pay a lot for internet access 9.9 euros a day while other hotels this service was free. The room also had no safe and no fridge bar. No coffe or drinks available in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: JKHEBoston
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really convenient to subway/public transportation. Several good coffee shops/cafes/restaurants nearby if you don't want to pay 17 euros for breakfast (yikes!). Room was clean and decently sized, not overly roomy but not tight. View was of an office building, so neighborhood was quiet in the evenings and overnight. Free internet in lobby and wifi (for a fee) in room. Staff at front desk were friendly and helpful. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sulurph
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I'm sucker for German buffet breakfasts and this one was no exception. Great selection of meats, veggies, cheeses, eggs, breads, yogurts and even fresh squeezed orange juice (you do the squeezing). Only drawback was the price (17 eu) and if it wasn't included in the room rate, I probably would not have gone for it. The hotel location is great-just a short walk from the main train station and 50 yards from a subway stop. I didn't eat dinners here, opting to eating out restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were comfortable, well lit, and very clean. Beds were okay but as noted by other reviewers, the pillows compress down to nothing (and I'm one who usually likes flat pillows). Complaints---no safe, no coffee maker/hot water kettle and no frig in the rooms. These amenities become is more important when considering there is also no room service. Also the internet price was kinda steep so I opted to wait in the lobby to use the one computer which wasn't always convenient but couldn't argue with the price. The hotel staff was pleasant and efficient so no complaints. All in all, a pleasant place to stay for business or pleasure and would give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, near train station”
Reviews.Author: rgrion
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect, you can go almost everywhere by foot. It is about 400 m from main train station (very beautiful) and no more than 8 minutes from Tegel airport. The place is safe, with lots of cafes and there is one piece of the famous wall about 500 m from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK Location, Not OK Bed, all else Good”
Reviews.Author: Dudload
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights just recently - got a very good rate through expedia so couldn't really complain. However, as below booked a "superior room" and ended up with two singles pushed together. Superior it ain't, especially for couples. I can't really see why i paid any more than standard as the room was small (although functional), but i can't imagine what the standard room size was like if this was superior. Also, no bath in a superior room = bit of an insult! The location is OK - its a bit of a walk to most stuff (10-15mins to Reichstag, 15 to central mitte, trains etc to Prenzlauer Berg or Kreuzberg) although the location is right next to a U-bahn station and is also v. quiet at night. Reception staff were very friendly and i have no complaints about the quality of service. One suggestion would be for the hotel to reduce the breakfast cost (€17 per person!!!) - i fail to see why anyone would choose to do this when Berlin has so many nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on great location”
Reviews.Author: LGSkage
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel! It is on a great location, walking distance from Berlin Hauptbahnhof, metro station just a few meters away and the great district of Prenzlauer Berg close by. The room was clean and nice with a very good bathroom. The staff was also very helpful and gave useful tips for using the public transport and what to see. Fast and reliable service; I wanted a second pillow and within minutes I got it delivered to my room. Another great thing, you can regulate the temperature in the room yourself!

Reviews.Title: “located just next to the most happening night life in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KDee_0212
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff guided us the right places to enjoy the night life in Berlin. It is walking distance from Alexanderplatz, if you enjoy walking and also tram and metro stations are located nearby for fast commute. Room was arranged propeoerly and was pretty clean. Nothing to mention which would not lead us to reommend this hotel to others. Also, this is located again, walking distance from the main train station of Berlin. When we reach the main statin, we saw clear signs indicating the distance and directions to reach the hotel. Overall nice place to stay for a weekend getaway in Berlin. further, we applied for the membership as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mateo007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just well located and the breakfast is super... but I must say that the service is rather soso!!! However I do not have anything to complain about!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, not far from the downtown”
Reviews.Author: Cleow77
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, in perfect Mercure Style. The room is quite big enough, with private bath and TV. We didn't have breakfast in our offer. The metro station (Natural History Museum stop) is less than 100mt far away. The hotel is clean, and not so far away you can see 1 of 3 last pieces of the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: IDakota
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff are very helpful, the breakfasts (which were included in our package) were excellent. It is within walking distance of museum island and has a bus stop and an U Bahn station directlty outside the hotel. Definitely recommended as a convenient base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location... a great stay...”
Reviews.Author: NotYourTypicalAussie
Reviews.Content: Located just out of the city area but close to everything. Spotlessly clean room, especially the bathroom. Quick and easy check in, restaurant/bar area, free internet in reception, hauptbahnhof 15 minute walk away, metro 30 second walk away, tram 30 second walk away, coffee shop on the corner. Public transport in Berlin is sensational and everywhere is so close.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: Mutiny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, about 1km in any direction to the main sights and train station. But the service and cleanliness was what won us over. The rooms were spotless and sparkling and every staff member we met was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was brilliant - we didn"t need to refuel again until about 2 or 3pm. We booked a deal with a late checkout of 4pm, which they happily extended to 6pm - perfect for us as we could come back and have a shower before flying out. The only thing I could complain about were the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gravity6
Reviews.Content: Very handy hotel in Berlin, close to the main train station (with a very handy bus that goes right past the hotel to the station) and an underground station. Also walking distance to the Reichstag, Brandenberg Tor and Under the Linden. As with all hotels in this chain. The rooms were small but clean, same with the bathroom. Service was friendly. Great value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: WhiteAnt2008
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with some of the earlier reviews regarding this hotel. It has an excellent location, with a bus stop outside the door that takes you on Bus 245 to the main rail station in two stops (or it’s an interesting walk through the line of the old Berlin Wall). There is a U-Bahn stop within 50 yards – and it’s a very shallow line, so you can be on a train inside a couple of minutes – only two stops to Friedrichstrasse, with an easy walk from there to Unter Den Linden or Checkpoint Charlie. There are also two tram lines, one of which will take you right through to Alexanderplatz, that are just as close. The downside is that it is set up as a “Business Hotel” and some of it’s charges are extreme – 16 Euros for an hour on the internet, 16 Euro for breakfast, 3.5 euro for the bottle of water in your room, plus a hard sell on the in-room movies. There are ways around things – a local convenience store and “Subway” sandwich shop avoid the prices in the bar and restaurant. There is a free internet terminal in reception – but it’s in high demand. One suggestion was the use of a local T-Mobile Zone that does seem to give a decent signal to rooms – however, this isn’t all it seems, as although you can get a high apparent bandwidth, the capacity is such you get extremely poor response – unusable at times. The TV has a good selection of channels – including BBC World News and CNN. I sampled two rooms advertised as doubles – one was two twins pushed together, the other a more conventional double, but both provided two single duvets. I would certainly revisit this hotel because of the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: This was a cut above a basic hotel. Small rooms, but clean and comfortable for two adults. Location was very convenient--walk to the Hauptbahnhof, walk or take a tram to Frierichstrasse and the Brandenburg Gate, convenient to a laundry where we washed clothes (a tram ride away). And the price was exceptional, lower than we would expect to pay in the U.S. In fact, we found in general that hotels in Germany were better priced than their U.S. counterparts, and definitely the least expensive places to stay in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a business trip but where's the food?”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowKauri
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't too bad: I didn't have many choices as there were a number of trade fairs and other events on in Berlin at the time I needed to be there for a conference. I found the room fairly comfortable, the female staff helpful, the male staff generally arrogant and annoyed about needing to provide service, the location convenient. A few small niggles- a double room with two single beds pushed together is fine, but putting two single-bed duvets on it does not a comfy night's sleep make- I tried a number of configurations and none of them really worked. On the other hand, I've never experienced such fluffy comfy pillows. They offer very expensive wifi access in your room- but I found a strong connection to T-mobile from my room that saved me a lot of money. The thing I couldn't get was: where's the food? You arrive late and want something to eat- if you know what to ask for, you can go for a 10-minute walk to a supermarket- but there's no kettle or mugs to make a hot drink, no room service, no minibar- nothing but a very expensive bottle of water. There is a restaurant and a cafe/bar downstairs, but these are not really comfy, they are a bit dressy and expensive; when I travel for work I like to slob out in my room and work or watch TV. Otherwise- nice, and a very convenient location for Berlin's fantastic transport system- and they will sell you travel tickets at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Colin
Reviews.Content: Had booked this after reading reviews on trip advisor, on the basis that it was reasonably close to the main station (newly opened in 2006 in time for the Euro Football Competition), and worked out we could get a bus 245 from the station to the hotel. I was initially worried about the selection on the basis of the accor hotel chain reputation for cheap and cheeful, but needn't have worried. The hotel room was wonderful, the shower the best on route so far, and the bed big and comfortable with spacious rooms. Had prebooked over the intenet for €89 per single room without breakfast, and on both days had breakfast elsewhere, although I did pop in and the breakfast did look good...but there again it would have to at €15 per head. Good selection of TV channels, but interestingly no safe or fridge, but a nice bar downstairs. The hotel also provided a free internet workstation but with a very uncomfortable stool, and the inbuilt computer security was a pain. The reception staff could not be faulted for friendliness and helpfulness, and we were certainly very happy with our choice on the basis of VFM, location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong with MERCURE”
Reviews.Author: NS007
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Mercure Hotel Berlin an der Charite for its closeness to the main station as we had to leave early for our next destination. Not only this but we have also stayed with the chain before and we were very pleased with the service. The hotel was located on a main road and was close to the jewish quarter and brandenberg gate. The staff are all very helpful and most speak good english. The rooms were nice and spacious but most of all very clean. The rooms seemed to be soundproof as we could not hear people next door nor outside. We were on the 3rd floor which could be accessed via the elevators. Breakfast wasnt included in our stay and was offered at an extra charge of 15Euro per person... we opted for sleeping in followed by a coffee & cake from down the street. All in all our stay here was very good with out any complaints and i can recommend staying here to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Mariako
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near metro station in Mitte area of Berlin and very close to bars and restaurants. It is clean with nice rooms and big bathrooms. Breakfast is rich and delicious. Suprise for us the free one-day travel card and the welcome drink. Staff kind and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “They gave away my room!”
Reviews.Author: spoongirl
Reviews.Content: I'd booked this hotel because of its proximity to Berlin's main station where I was arriving late in the evening and leaving at the crack of dawn the next morning. I booked through Octopus who I regularly use. I'd pre-paid, my room was guaranteed for late arrival and I'd even stated on the booking notes what time I would be there. Having got there as planned at 9.30pm, the reception was packed with a tour party and I was told they had given away my room. No explanation and very little apology was offered but the receptionist brightly told me they had booked a room in another hotel for me, which when I asked to see it on a map turned out to be miles away, not to mention cheaper than the Charite. They said they would send me there in a cab and I could have a complimentary drink in the bar when I got there by way of compensation. Uh, no. Worse still they couldn't given me a cab back to the station the following day. Seeing as I had pre-paid and the hotel admitted they were aware I was arriving late this was shocking and I told them they would have to find me another hotel nearer to the station. Of course by that time of night everywhere was full, at least on the list of other Mercure Hotels or hotels they regularly dealt with. They'd also had full contact details for me on my booking form and could have contacted me at any time that day giving them time to find me a more suitably located hotel but had failed to do so. I had to kick up a huge fuss, which I'm not prone to doing, to get them to even try and rectify the situation. Their main response to anything was to say it wasn't their fault! Eventually they booked me into the Jolly Hotel Vivaldi (which was jolly nice), which took all of two seconds and they could have just done in the first place. Then they took half an hour to get me a cab. I finally got to check in to the Vivaldi at 11pm. I know that the Charite gets good reviews on here and I don't doubt them for a second, it was part of the reason I chose the hotel over others in the area, but their handling of the situation was very very poor and it should never have happened in the first place. Hopefully it was a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Crwydryn
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Mercure Hotel Berlin an der Charite, and on both occasions I've found that it met my needs and was generally good value (it was booked for me by a colleague I was visiting). As a woman travelling alone, I also appreciated the fact that I felt safe here. Location: convenient for public transport, for access to the main station (Berlin Hauptbahnhof), and for the Humboldt University of Berlin. The staff are all helpful, efficient, and speak good English and in some cases a number of other European languages. Rooms are spotlessly clean, showers are good, and beds are comfortable for one, though I agree with a previous reviewer that for two tall adults the double beds would be a little cramped. Bedroom lighting: good in comparison with many hotels where it's insufficient. Heating/cooling: when I stayed in early June, Berlin was experiencing 30 deg C temperatures, so I kept the window shut and used the air-conditioning - very effective and quiet, if not very environmentally sound. The breakfast buffet is of good quality and offers plenty of choice. Minor criticisms: 1. I would have appreciated a safety-deposit box in the room, and a kettle etc. to make hot drinks; however I appreciate that this facility is less common on mainland Europe than in the UK or US. 2. Internet access was convenient, fast and reliable, but very expensive at nearly 20 Euros for 24 hours, unless you just wanted a few minutes (0.3 Euros per minute up to 1 hour in any 24 hour period). A budget/mid-range hotel should really offer better deals than this. Otherwise, a good choice for this area of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard value without frills”
Reviews.Author: frank2007
Reviews.Content: Good standard Mercure hotel; well located within walking distance of the Mitte business and govt district and the restaurant and bar areas of Oranienburger Strasse. Very competetively priced, like most Berlin hotels. A no-frills chain product; can be recommended without second thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice chain hotel with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroNavarra
Reviews.Content: This hotel it is placed 15 minutes away walking from the central station. There is also a train station 15 meters away from the hotel (zinnowitzer), that it is only 2 stops away from FriedrichStrasse. It is a quiet neighbourghood, it has some museums and ministrys around it. There are some places to eat around the hotel, but I was not able to test it. The hotel it is a typical hotel of a french chain of hotel. The rooms have a good size, but the forniture it is very "standard", very functional but without style. The rooms was very silent (I was in the fith floor). The best of the hotel it is the breakfast, it has a good assortiment of food, cakes, sausages, eggs, orange juice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next door to the Museum of Natural History. It is a 15 minute walk from the Hauptbahnof (main train station). Museum Island is about 15 minutes from the hotel as well the Friedrichstrasse U-bahn and S-bahn station. Both this and the Hauptbahnof let you connect to the rest of the city in no time. Room was clean and more than adequate for a short visit to the city. Great breakfast buffet selections.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ttcat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable, clean, quiet and centrally located. It is very reasonably priced for what it offers. Its functional modern decor should please any traveler unless he is looking for super luxury or romantic glamor. The staff speak good English and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as last time”
Reviews.Author: darrenmcc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again almost exactly a year after my last stay. The room was slightly bigger and the receptionist put me on the 7th floor right at the back, so although it was a hike to the lifts there was a great view over the rooftops and the room was quiet. However, on the 3rd morning I was rudely awoken at 7:00 by workmen tearing up the carpet, which was being relaid throughout the hotel (and by the time I left the next day, had not been relaid, making the floor look very tatty). On asking at reception, there was no explanation and in fact the receptionist seemed to have no idea that this was going on. Later that afternoon on returning to the hotel, I found that my key card had been cancelled in an effort to get me back to reception to be offered a change of room (unwanted) and a voucher for a drink (unusable in the time I had left). Not impressed; this whole situation could have been handled a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value, Clean Modern”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Not quite in the centre of the city, but a short walk or next-door tube stop makes getting around easy. On the edge of east berlin with some interesting archiceture in the surrounding streets. Clean modern efficient hotel. Works well. Gets on with the job of being a clean efficient hotel without some of the "pointless pompousness" you find in "more established" hotels. Room was large and clean. Bar and Restaurant modern, clean and efficient. Good value means it is recommended for all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Susan66
Reviews.Content: Immaculate 3 star offering allround excellent value. I paid EUR 87 per night (including a delicious and plentiful breakfast). Must be one of the best deals in Berlin! Though the hotel is not in the most hip and happening part of Berlin, it boasts very good transportation links to places that are. The Oranienburger Strasse area, Kreuzberg, Mitte and Prenzlauerberg all can be reached by U-Bahn in a couple of minutes. From Schönefeld it is the S-Bahn to Friedrichstrasse, then 2 stops on the U6 in the direction of Alt-Tegel to Zinnowitzer Strasse. Hotel is literally 50 meters away. From Tegel, it's best to take a taxi (about EUR 14) as public transportation links to and from Tegel are rather bad. The hotel doesn't look very appealing from the outside but the rooms are clean, comfortable, modern and are furnished with nice accessories like an Artemide Tolomeo desk lamp. Bathroom well appointed with high quality toiletries and a walk-in shower. I would not choose this hotel for its atmosphere, facilities or location. This hotel is a great option for a business traveller or tourist who wants comfort and the basics but can do without a spa or swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet hotel with friendly staff and excellent value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Olygirl
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with very friendly staff. Breakfast was very good. Rooms weren't big but clean, modern, practical and quiet. The bar was lively at night with hotel guests only. 80% of hotel guests were German. The hotel is a few steps away from a U-Bahn station, which makes it easily accessible. Not much night life in the vicinity but the U-Bahn runs until the wee hours of the morning. We paid 66 Euro a night for a double room with twin beds (pushed together), breakfast, a welcome drink and one Tageskarte for transportation. It was a summer special for 3 nights. We felt it was an excellent price for an excellent hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BrianfromKingsbury
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel for three nights whilst we visited the Christmas markets. It was easy to find after we took a bus from Tegel airport and a single journey on the U-bahn. We had made an advanced internet booking which worked out at just over one hundred English pounds for three nights for the room alone. The staff made us welcome and the room was excellent. We did not take any meals at the hotel but used the bar in the evening where prices were similar to local cafes. Free internet access just by the bar was useful. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Paz_e_Bem
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel (2 adults 1 child). It is quite modern (not more than 2 years old), very clean, they gave us a large beautiful family room, staff is efficient. Just beware the pillows, they are too soft but you can ask some more at the reception. Nice breackfast and wonderful located, 50 meters from an U-Bahn station and 1 Km away from the Main Railway Station (HauptBanhof). And Berlin is a great lovely city. Will be back and at Mercure Charite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gtreat value”
Reviews.Author: 100years
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is within walking distance of Oranienburger Strasse and all its bars and restaurants but there is a tram stop and subway stop less than 1 min from the front door of the hotel. Its a very clean and modern hotel and the bar always seemed to be quite popular but not noisy. We stayed here for three nights over a weekend and it was great value for money...€200 for the three nights for a double room. We would stay here again , next time we visit berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Superior 3 Star in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: One of the best 3 star hotels we've stayed in - and at the bargain non-refundable rate of Euro €45 a night for 4 nights this was financially perfect. Very easy to get to from Schonefeld; regional train to Friedrichstrasse then 2 stops on the U6 in the direction of Alt-Tegel to Zinnowitzer Strasse. Hotel is less than 1 minute walk from the station. Good local area with excellent transport links and a late bus that stops right outside every 30 mins during the night. Brilliant if you're out in the City til the early hours which we always are (no art galleries and museums for us I'm afraid!!) Lots of bars and restaurants 1 stop away in the Oranienburger Strasse and Tor areas. However, you need to explore Berlin (Hackescher Markt, Kreuzberg and Mitte in particular), we only had the odd drink in the areas close to the hotel for convenience. Immaculately clean, professional and modern looking hotel. Not particularly inspiring from the outside but this is a well-appointed member of the Accor brand. Good points: Great bathroom and brilliant walk-in power-shower, spot lighting, comfortable bed and superbly friendly and helpful staff. Minus points: no safe, no tea/coffee, small room also our double room was two singles pushed together. We would not stay at this hotel again as we always stay somewhere different in our twice yearly visits to the city. However, this hotel cannot be faulted in any way and it comes fully recommended without hesitation. Behind the Accor Suitehotel Potsdamer Platz this is the best place we have stayed at in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great value - in der mitte”
Reviews.Author: lazysusan
Reviews.Content: just returned from a two night stay at the mercure - a very unpromising facade, but don't let that put you off! We payed around 70 euro a night - and i was pleasently surprised. We had an enormous room, big comfy kingsize bed and a great shower. Couldn't ask for anymore really, about a 20 minute stroll to mitte and hackescher markt. A good value base in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Mariia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mercure an der Charite (former Dorint an der Charite, according to the towels…) in August 2005 during our Berlin weekend break. We travel a lot, and in my opinion the deal was excellent: 59 euros per night (the breakfast would have been available for 13 euros per person). The hotel is conveniently located next to Zinnerwitzer subway station, and you can easily travel from Tegel airport by using public transportation. Our room was smallish and simply decorated, and very clean. The only thing we missed was a minibar (in other words: a fridge to keep water bottles cold), but for this rate it is fully understandable that there is not one. I was very glad that the hairdryer in the room was powerful enough, unfortunately many hotels have these wall-mounted "jokes" and it takes ages to dry thick long hair with those. There are 2 supermarkets, Subway sandwich shop and Balzaco coffee shop around the corner. I would also like to recommend SpeiseKombinat - the restaurant located at Chaussee Strasse (again, around the corner). Delicious, affordably priced eastern-mediterranean food - if weather allows, enjoy your meal at their patio. We also visited "Hafenbar" near the hotel. If you are in your early twenties, german speaker plus love 70's hits - this disco is for you. Other folks - you'd better skip the place ;)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: mellowjonny
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a long weekend in Berlin, once I had mastered the S Bahn and U Bahn it was easy to get to Zinnowitzer Strasse station (50m away from the hotel). Rooms were nicely furnished, very modern and light, however room is a little small- but if you are a tourist it's ideal. Only a shower in the bathroom, so if you like a soak in the bath after a lot of walking then this is probably not for you! Safe deposit boxes are available from the main reception, so don't panic like I did thinking their is nowhere to leave your money! Their is a deposit to pay which is refunded when you check out. Staff were very polite and helpful, they spoke much better English than I spoke German and had a lot of helpful information to supply me with. Close to Oranienburger Strasse, with numerous places to eat, and from their most attractions are within walking distance. Berlin is accesible by foot, however the U and S Bahns will probably be used, so being close to a station is helpful. Only takes a matter of minutes to travel between stations - be careful though, on weekends the U Bahn does not run as frequently!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice - once right after it opened in December 2002 and then in August, 2003, when it was still a Dorint. The staff was friendly and helpful. The clientele is mostly European with few Americans - so few, in fact, that the bartender remembered me on my second visit! Rooms are compact, but well designed. Location is terrific - convenient to bus, tram and U-Bahn. Buffet breakfast (included) was plentiful and good. On my second trip, I had a package which included two dinners, not nearly as good as the breakfasts. The menu is unaccountably Italian, which seemed to stretch the skills of the German chef. But since the meals were esstentially free and they served late, I didn't much care. I prefer staying in the East, where most of the hotels are new and expensive, so I consider this a great find and would definitely stay here again.
